title: The One With Five Steaks and an Eggplant

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: At Chandler and Joey's. Ross and Chandler are there. Ross is watching
wrestling.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Man, I sure miss Julie.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Spanish midgets. Spanish midgets wrestling. Julie. Ok, yes, I see how you got there. (phone rings)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You ever figure out what that thing's for?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, see, I'm trying this new screening thing. You know, I figure if I'm always answering the phone, people'll think I don't have a life. My god, Rodrigo never gets pinned.

dialogue.speaker: MACHINE--JOEY'S VOICE)
dialogue.text: Here comes the beep, you know what to do.

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Hello, I'm looking for Bob. This is Jane. I don't know if you're still at this number, but I was just thinking about us, and how great it was, and, well, I know it's been three years, but, I was kinda hoping we could hook up again. I barely had t he nerve to make this call, so you know what I did?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: I got a little drunk...and naked.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Bob here.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (on phone) What've you been up to?

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Oh, you know, the usual, teaching aerobics, partying way too much. Oh, and in case you were wondering, those are my legs on the new James Bond poster.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Can you hold on a moment? I have another call. (to Ross) I love her.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm back.

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: So, are we gonna get together or what?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Um, absolutely. Uh, how 'bout tomorrow afternoon? Do you know uh, Central Perk in the Village, say, five-ish?

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Great, I'll see you then.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok. Ok. Having a phone has finally paid off.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Even though you do do a good Bob impression, I'm thinkin' when she sees you tomorow, she's probably gonna realize, "hey, you're not Bob."

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm hoping that when Bob doesn't show up, she will seek comfort in the open arms of the wry stranger at the next table.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my god. You are pure evil.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, pure evil, horny and alone. I've done this.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on phone) Yeah, yeah, everybody's here. Hey, everybody, say hi to Julie in New Mexico.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hi, Julie!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (sarcastically) Hi, Julie.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, while Ross is on the phone, everybody owes me 62 bucks for his birthday.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, is, is there any chance that you're rounding up? You know, like from, like 20?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, come on, we got the gift, the concert, and the cake.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Do we need a cake?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look guys, I know it's a little steep.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, whoosh!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: But it's Ross.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It's Ross.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'll see you guys later, I gotta go...do a thing.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, sweetheart, I'll call you later tonight. Whoa, whoa, whoa, hey, hey, hey, you're not really gonna go through with this, are you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, I think I might just.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So uh, what are you guys doing for dinner tonight?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well I guess I gotta start savin' up for Ross's birthday, so I guess I'll just stay home and eat dust bunnies.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Can you believe how much this is gonna cost?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Do you guys ever get the feeling that um, Chandler and those guys just don't get that we don't make as much money as they do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yes! Yeah, it's like they're always saying "let's go here, let's go there". Like we can afford to go here and there.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, and it's, and we always have to go to, you know, someplace nice, you know? God, and it's not like we can say anything about it, 'cause, like this birthday thing, it's for Ross.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: For Ross.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: For Ross, Ross, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (enters) Oh my god.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm at work, ordinary day, you know, chop chop chop, sauti, sauti, sauti. All of a sudden, Leon, the manager, calls me into his office. It turns out they fired the head lunch chef, and guess who got the job.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: If it's not you, this is a horrible story.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Fortunately, it is me. And, they made me head of purchasing, thank you very much. Anyway, I just ran into Ross and Chandler downstairs, and they think we should go out and celebrate. You know, someplace nice.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, someplace nice. (to Phoebe and Rachel) How much do you think I can get for my kidney? (at Central Perk)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm tellin' you. You can't do this.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, come on. I can never get a girl like that with conventional methods.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That doesn't matter. She wanted to call Bob. Hey, for all we know, Bob is who she was meant to be with. You may be destroying two people's chance for happiness.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We don't know Bob, ok? We know me. We like me. Please let me be happy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Go over there and tell that woman the truth.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Go.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Listen, I have to, uh, um, I have to, I have to confess something.

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Yes?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Whoever stood you up is a jerk.

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: How did you--?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don't know. I just had this weird sense. You know, but that's me. I'm weird and sensitive. Tissue?

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, you keep the pack. I'm all cried out today.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, ok, here is to my sister, the newly-appointed head lunch chef--

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Who is also in charge of purchasing.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Newly appointed head lunch chef who is also in charge of purchasing--

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Who has her own little desk when Roland's not there.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, lunch chef, purchasing, own little desk when Roland's not there. Here's to my little sister--

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, and I got a beeper!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Cool.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Let's see!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's fine, I'll just wait!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, sorry.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sorry, sorry.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Monica!

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: Are we ready to order?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, you know what, we haven't even looked yet.

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: Well, when you do, just let me know. I'll be right over there on the edge of my seat.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow, look at these prices.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, these are pretty ch-ching.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What are these, like famous chickens?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, sorry I'm late. Congratulations, Mon. (to Ross) I'm not sorry I'm late. How incredible was my afternoon with Jade?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, pretty incredible according to the message she left you on my machine. Hey, Chandler, why is this woman leaving a message for you on my machine?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, see, I had to tell her that my number was your number, because I couldn't tell her that my number was my number because she thinks that my number is Bob's number.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, tell me again, what do I do when Mr. Roper calls?

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: Do I dare ask?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes, I will start with the carpaccio, and then I'll have the grilled prawns.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That sounds great. Same for me.

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: And for the gentleman?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'll have the Thai chicken pizza. But, hey, look, if I get it without the nuts and leeks and stuff, is it cheaper?

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: You'd think, wouldn't you? Miss?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, I will have the uh, (whispers) side salad.

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: (whispers) And what will that be on the side of?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh, I don't know. Why don't you put it right here next to my water?

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: And for you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, I'm gonna have a cup of the cucumber soup, and, um, take care.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I will have the uh, Cajun catfish.

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: Anything else?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, how 'bout a verse of Killing Me Softly. You're gonna sneeze on my fish, aren't you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (using calculator) Plus tip, divided by six. Ok, everyone owes 28 bucks.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Um, everyone?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, you're right, I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Monica's big night, she shouldn't pay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So five of us is, $33.50 apiece.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, huh uh, no way, I'm sorry, not gonna happen.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, prom night flashback.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Monica, I'm really happy you got promoted, but cold cucumber mush for thirty-something bucks? No! Rachel just had that, that, that salad, and, and Joey with his like teeny pizza! It's just...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, Pheebs! How 'bout we'll each just pay for what we had. It's no big deal.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Not for you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, what's goin' on?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, look you guys, I really don't want to get into this right now. I think it'll just make everyone uncomfortable.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Fine. All right, fine.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You can tell us.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hello, it's us, all right? It'll be fine.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ok, um, uh, we three feel like, that uh, sometimes you guys don't get that uh, we don't have as much money as you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ok.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I hear ya.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We can talk about that.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, then...Let's.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I, I just never think of money as an issue.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That's 'cause you have it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's a good point.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So um, how come you guys haven't talked about this before?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: 'Cause it's always somethin', you know, like Monica's new job, or the whole Ross's birthday hoopla.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wha--? Whoa, hey, I don't want my birthday to be the source of any kind of negative--there's gonna be a hoopla?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Basically, there's the thing, and then there's the stuff after the thing.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: If it makes anybody feel better, then we can just forget the thing, and we'll just do the gift.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: G-gift? The thing's not the gift?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, the thing was, we were gonna go see Hootie and the Blowfish.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hootie and the--oh my. I, I can catch them on the radio.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, now I feel bad. You wanna go to the concert.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, look, hey, it's my birthday, and the important thing is that we all be together.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All of us.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Together.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Not at the concert.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, the ebola virus. That's gotta suck, huh?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Gee, Monica, what's in the bag?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don't know, Chandler. Let's take a look.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, it's like a skit.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why, it's dinner for six. 5 steaks, and an eggplant for Phoebe.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Whoo!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Cool.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, we switched meat suppliers at work, and the new guys gave me the steaks as sort of a thank-you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: But wait, there's more. Hey, Chandler, what is in the envelope?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: By the way, this didn't seem so dorky in the hall.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Why, it's six tickets to Hootie and the Blowfish! The Blowfish!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It's on us, all right, so don't worry. It's our treat.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So...Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Could you be less enthused?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, it's a nice gesture, it is. But it just feels like--

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Like?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Charity.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Charity?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We're just tryin' to do a nice thing here.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, you have to understand that your nice thing makes us feel this big.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Actually, it makes us feel that big.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't, I don't understand. I mean, you, it's like we can't win with you guys.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: If you guys feel this big, maybe that's not our fault. Maybe that's just how you feel.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, now you're tellin' us how you feel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, we never shoulda talked about this.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'm just gonna pass on the concert, 'cause I'm just not in a very Hootie place right now.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Me neither.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Me too.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Guys, we bought the tickets.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, well, then you'll have extra seats, you know, for all your tiaras and stuff.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Why did you look at me when you said that?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, I guess now we can't go.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What? Come on, you do what you want to do. Do we always have to do everything together?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know what? You're right.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Fine.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Fine.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Fine.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Fine.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Fine.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right. We're gonna go. It's not for another six hours. We're gonna go then.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Chandler!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Geez! Are you ready?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah. Just let me grab my jacket and tell you I had sex today.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Whoa! You had sex today?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wow, it sounds even cooler when somebody else says it. I was awesome, ok? She was biting her lip to stop from screaming.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Now I know it's been awhile, but I took it as a good sign.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Still doing the screening thing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I had sex today. I never have to answer that phone again.

dialogue.speaker: MACHINE
dialogue.text: Here comes the beep, you know what to do.

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Hey, Bob, it's Jade. Listen, I just wanted to tell you that I was really hurt when you didn't show up the other day, and just so you know, I ended up meeting a guy.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Bob here.

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Oh, hi.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, uh, you met someone, huh?

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, I did. In fact, I had sex with him 2 hours ago.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, uh, how was he?

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Eh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Eh?

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Oh, Bob, he was nothing compared to you. I had to bite my lip to keep from screaming your name.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, that makes me feel so good.

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: It was just so awkward and bumpy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (silently mouthing) Bumpy?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, maybe he had some kind of uh, new, cool style, that you're not familiar with. And uh maybe you have to get used to it.

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Well there really wasn't much time to get used to it, you know what I mean?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know what? I'm not gonna be able to enjoy this.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know, it's my birthday. We all should be here.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, let's go.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well maybe, you know, maybe we should stay for one song.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I mean, it would be rude to them for us to leave now.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know, the guys are probably having a great time.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on you guys, one more time.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok. One.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nooo.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That was amazing!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Excellent, that was excellent.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can't believe the guys missed this.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What guys? Oh, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Excuse me, you're Monica Geller aren't you?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do I know you?

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: You used to be my babysitter.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my god, little Stevie Fisher? How've you been?

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Good, good, I'm a lawyer now.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You can't be a lawyer. You're eight.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Listen, it was nice to see you. I gotta run backstage.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, wait, backstage?

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, my firm represents the band.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ross.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: How are you? Look, you guys wanna meet the group? Come on. So, are you one of the ones who fooled around with my dad?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, you guys.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Happy birthday.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you, thanks. So uh, how was your night last night?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, well, it pretty much sucked. How was yours?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, ours pretty much sucked, oh, but, I did run into little Stevie Fisher. Remember him?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh yeah. I used to babysit him. Hey, how's his dad?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, good.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, aside from that, the whole evening was pretty much a bust.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, we really missed you guys.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, look, we were just saying, this whole thing is really stupid.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: We just have to really, really, really, not let stuff like money get--is that a hickey?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, I just, I fell down.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: On someone's lips? Where'd you get the hickey?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know, a party, or--

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What party?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It wasn't so much a party as...a gathering of people, with food, and music, and, and the band.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You partied with Hootie and the Blowfish?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, apparently Stevie and the band are like this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Who gave you that hickey?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That would be the work of a Blowfish.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh! I can't believe it. I can't believe this. We're just like, sitting at home, trying to guess Joey's fingers, and you guys are out like partying and having fun, and you know, all, "hey, Blowfish, suck on my neck".

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, don't blame us. You guys coulda been there, you know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What, as part of your poor friends outreach program?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It's work.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don't know what to say. I'm sorry that we make more money than you. But we're not gonna feel guilty about it. We work really hard for it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: And we don't work hard?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (on phone) Yeah, hi, it's Monica. I just got a page.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm just saying that sometimes we like to do stuff that costs a little more.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: And you feel like we hold you back.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Leon, Leon. Shhh! Guys. Wait, I don't understand. Those steaks were just a gift from the meat vendor. That was not a kick back. I'll just replace them and we can forget the whole thing. What corporate policy? No. Yeah. All right. I just got fired.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogue.text: Here's your check. That'll be $4.12.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Let me get that. (to Chandler) You got five bucks?

dialogue.speaker: MACHINE
dialogue.text: Here comes the beep, you know what to do.

dialogue.speaker: JADE
dialogue.text: Hi, it's me. Listen, Bob. I'm probably way out of line here. I mean, It has been 3 years, and you're probably seeing someone else now, but if we could just have one night together, just for old time's sake, one hot, steamy, wild night...

scenes.location:
At Chandler and Joey's. Ross and Chandler are there. Ross is watching
wrestling.
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: At Chandler and Joey's. Ross and Chandler are there. Ross is watching
wrestling.]

events.event_description: Chandler answers the phone and attempts to screen calls to avoid answering when he has a social life.
Jade calls Bob and confesses she is thinking about reconnecting with him after three years, while drunk and naked.
Chandler, pretending to be Bob, arranges to meet Jade at Central Perk the next day.
Chandler reveals to Ross that he has been pretending to be Bob to Jade, planning to deceive her about his identity.
Ross advises Chandler to tell Jade the truth, but Chandler decides to go through with the deception.
Chandler, on the phone, confesses to Jade that whoever stood her up is a jerk, and admits he is the one who stood her up.
Chandler, after confessing, tells Jade that he had sex with someone else two hours prior, implying he is not Bob.
Chandler and Ross toast Chandler's sister Monica for her new job as head of purchasing and lunch chef.
The group discusses the cost of their dinner and the financial disparity between them and Chandler and Joey.
Monica reveals she was fired from her job and was promoted to head of purchasing, suggesting she is celebrating her new position.
